result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arnold Eugene Branch Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Arnold Eugene Branch Jr not in court. Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii appeared by video for Arnold Eugene Branch Jr.  Attorney Alexander Geocaris in court on behalf of Eric Bashirian for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for final pretrial. Defendant appeared in the AM, appearance is waived at the calling of this matter. State is in trial in another Branch. Defense requested an adjournment of the jury trial. State does not object to the adjournment. Court vacates the scheduled jury trial date and adjourn matter for a status. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Arnold Eugene Branch Jr in court.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Arnold Eugene Branch Jr.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Court set final pretrial and jury trial dates upon request from the defense.  Court ordered all substantive motions to be filed by September 24, 2022 and all motions in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pre-trial date.  Case adjourned to Branch 11, Rm 608 CH.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 9-09-2022

Defendant Arnold Eugene Branch in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defense counsel has received discovery and will receive an offer and requests additional time to review.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Arnold Eugene Branch in court, appear by video with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw, appear in person.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.  Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated June 7, 2022 - received

Defendant Arnold Eugene Branch in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

22RM021172  Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
4/21/2022

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Arnold Eugene Branch in court with attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Arnold Eugene Branch in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
